{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3353327,"name":"","username":"warmful","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/warmful/{size}/218474_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-06T12:23:54.215Z","cooked":"

Currently, I’m using Python and an rPi 4 hooked up to a USB camera. I realized that the exposure adjusts based on the a change in lighting conditions (ex someone puts their hand in front of the camera), which is not ideal. Does anyone know how to lock the exposure and set it without having to manually do it everytime in the WPILib Imager?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-06T12:23:54.215Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461446,"topic_slug":"lock-set-exposure-for-rpi-usb-camera","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/lock-set-exposure-for-rpi-usb-camera/461446/1","custom_user_title":"4829 Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3353378,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-06T14:45:54.739Z","cooked":"

This function can be used to do it: VideoCamera (WPILib API 2024.3.2)

Although it’s been reported that sometimes it doesn’t work due to property name differences, in which case you can use getProperty(name) to get the same property name as what appears on the camera streaming webpage and set it via the returned VideoProperty.

The annoying thing about trying to write “generic” camera settings like exposure is they can be order dependent and the exact property names vary.

Alright thanks. How would I write this line in Python since the docs are for java? Is there another way to do it ex. set up the json file to lock the exposure on the WPILib image on wpilibpi.local? I’ve tried to change/upload a json in the past and it doesn’t really work.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-06T15:30:21.678Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461446,"topic_slug":"lock-set-exposure-for-rpi-usb-camera","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/lock-set-exposure-for-rpi-usb-camera/461446/3","custom_user_title":"4829 Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353410,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-06T16:33:40.110Z","cooked":"

It’s identical in Python: VideoSource — RobotPy API documentation

prop = camera.getProperty("something")  # something = property name in the webpage
prop.set(value)  # value you want to set
warmful:

Is there another way to do it ex. set up the json file to lock the exposure on the WPILib image on wpilibpi.local? I’ve tried to change/upload a json in the past and it doesn’t really work.

That should work, but due to Linux property name changes, sometimes doesn’t.

So this code should work?

   exposure = camera.getProperty("exposure_absolute")
   exposure.set(50)

There’s also an exposure mode (auto/manual/hold current) that must be set prior to setting the value.

Yeah I did see that on the web dashboard. How would I set it to manual since it is a toggle instead of on a numeric scale?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T14:20:16.510Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":20,"readers_count":19,"score":9.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461446,"topic_slug":"lock-set-exposure-for-rpi-usb-camera","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/lock-set-exposure-for-rpi-usb-camera/461446/7","custom_user_title":"4829 Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353970,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T14:59:56.151Z","cooked":"

If it’s a drop down, you can use getChoices() to get a list, and the value to set using set() is the list index of the desired setting (eg the first option is 0, second option is 1, etc). If it’s just a checkbox, then set(1) is true, set(0) is false.
